meanings: Assistant adverb do something while doing something
초대와 방문 Can you stay for dinner?
초대와 방문 Can you stay and have dinner with us?
초대와 방문 Can you join us for dinner?

phrases.phrase: 사장님이 2주 내내 출장가실 거라니 정말 좋은데!
meanings: 직장에서의 표현 I can't believe the boss is going to be out of town for two whole weeks!
실용회화-도보이용 Where would you like to go?

examples.korean: Where are you going for your holidays this year? 발음듣기 올해는 휴가를 어디로 가실 건가요? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Where are you going for your holidays this year? 발음

examples.korean: Your suit will be ready for collection on Tuesday. 발음듣기 당신 양복은 화요일이면 찾아 가실 수 있을 겁니다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Your suit will be ready for collection on Tuesday. 발음

examples.korean: Do you need a visa for the USA? 발음듣기 미국에 가실 비자가 필요하세요? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Do you need a visa for the USA? 발음

examples.korean: ‘How are you going to France?’ ‘We’re going by boat.’ 발음듣기 “프랑스는 어떻게 가실 건가요?” “배로 갈 거예요.” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘How are you going to France?’ ‘We’re going by boat.’ 발음

examples.korean: ‘Will you come with us tonight?’ ‘I won’t, if you don’t mind—I’ve got a lot of work to do.’ 발음듣기 “오늘 밤 우리와 함께 가실 거예요?” “죄송하지만 아니에요. 할 일이 많아서요.” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘Will you come with us tonight?’ ‘I won’t, if you don’t mind—I’ve got a lot of work to do.’ 발음
